Title: Written reply to PQ on resale of excess power
Questions: Can households with small solar panel systems sell their excess power?
answers: Yes, households with small solar panel systems can sell their excess power into the wholesale electricity market through SP Services as an intermediary, via schemes such as the Simplified Credit Treatment (SCT) scheme or Enhanced Central Intermediary Scheme (ECIS).

Title: Written reply to PQ on resale of excess power
Questions: Can businesses with small solar panel systems sell their excess power?
answers: Yes, businesses with small solar panel systems can sell their excess power into the wholesale electricity market through SP Services as an intermediary, via schemes such as the Simplified Credit Treatment (SCT) scheme or Enhanced Central Intermediary Scheme (ECIS).

Title: Written reply to PQ on resale of excess power
Questions: How can businesses with larger solar panel systems sell their excess power?
answers: Businesses with larger solar panel systems can sell their excess power directly into the wholesale electricity market, by registering as a market participant with the Energy Market Company.

answers: The Simplified Credit Treatment (SCT) scheme is a scheme that allows households and businesses with small solar panel systems to sell their excess power into the wholesale electricity market through SP Services as an intermediary.

Title: Written reply to PQ on resale of excess power
Questions: What is the Enhanced Central Intermediary Scheme (ECIS)?
answers: The Enhanced Central Intermediary Scheme (ECIS) is a scheme that allows households and businesses with small solar panel systems to sell their excess power into the wholesale electricity market through SP Services as an intermediary.

Title: Written reply to PQ on resale of excess power
Questions: Can households and businesses with small solar panel systems sell their excess power directly into the wholesale electricity market?
answers: No, households and businesses with small solar panel systems can only sell their excess power into the wholesale electricity market through SP Services as an intermediary, via schemes such as the Simplified Credit Treatment (SCT) scheme or Enhanced Central Intermediary Scheme (ECIS).

Title: Written reply to PQ on resale of excess power
Questions: What is the Energy Market Company?
answers: The Energy Market Company is a company that operates the wholesale electricity market in Singapore and facilitates the trading of electricity among market participants.

Title: Written reply to PQ on resale of excess power
Questions: Can businesses with small solar panel systems register as a market participant with the Energy Market Company?
answers: Yes, businesses with small solar panel systems can register as a market participant with the Energy Market Company and sell their excess power directly into the wholesale electricity market.

Title: Written reply to PQ on resale of excess power
Questions: Where can I find more information about selling excess power from solar panel systems?
answers: More information can be found on the Energy Market Authority (EMA)’s website at https://www.ema.gov.sg/Guide_to_Solar_PV.aspx.

Title: Written reply to PQ on resale of excess power
Questions: Can households with larger solar panel systems sell their excess power directly into the wholesale electricity market?
answers: It is not mentioned in the summary whether households with larger solar panel systems can sell their excess power directly into the wholesale electricity market. However, businesses with larger solar panel systems can do so by registering as a market participant with the Energy Market Company.

Title: Oral reply to PQ on energy and electricity
Questions: What is the second switch for Singapore's energy supply?
answers: The second switch for Singapore's energy supply is solar energy.

Title: Oral reply to PQ on energy and electricity
Questions: How much has solar capacity increased in Singapore over the last 10 years?
answers: Solar capacity has increased from 3.8 megawatt peak in 2010 to around 400 megawatt-peak in mid-2020.

Title: Oral reply to PQ on energy and electricity
Questions: What is Singapore's plan for solar capacity by 2025?
answers: Singapore plans to almost quadruple its solar capacity to 1.5 gigawatt-peak by 2025.

Title: Oral reply to PQ on energy and electricity
Questions: What is Singapore's plan for solar capacity by 2030?
answers: Singapore plans to increase its solar capacity to 2 gigawatt-peak by 2030.

Title: Oral reply to PQ on energy and electricity
Questions: What percentage of Singapore's total electricity consumption is expected to be supplied by solar energy by 2030?
answers: By 2030, solar energy is expected to supply around 3% of Singapore's total electricity consumption.

Title: Oral reply to PQ on energy and electricity
Questions: Which local companies are partnering with the government to deploy solar photovoltaic systems?
answers: Local companies are partnering with the government to deploy solar photovoltaic systems.

Title: Oral reply to PQ on energy and electricity
Questions: Which company is a major participant in the SolarNova programme?
answers: The Sunseap Group is a major participant in the SolarNova programme.

Title: Oral reply to PQ on energy and electricity
Questions: What is the current solar capacity in Singapore?
answers: The current solar capacity in Singapore is around 400 megawatt-peak.

Title: Oral reply to PQ on energy and electricity
Questions: What was the solar capacity in Singapore in 2010?
answers: The solar capacity in Singapore was 3.8 megawatt peak in 2010.

Title: Oral reply to PQ on energy and electricity
Questions: What is the goal of Singapore's solar energy plan?
answers: The goal of Singapore's solar energy plan is to increase the use of solar energy as a source of electricity.

Title: Written reply to PQs on Sun Cable
Questions: What is Singapore doing to accelerate the deployment of renewable energy?
answers: Singapore is accelerating the deployment of solar energy, which is the most viable renewable energy source in Singapore.

Title: Written reply to PQs on Sun Cable
Questions: What is the National Hydrogen Strategy?
answers: The National Hydrogen Strategy was published in October last year.

Title: Written reply to PQs on Sun Cable
Questions: What is the ammonia power generation project?
answers: An Expression of Interest (EOI) exercise for an ammonia power generation project has been launched.

Title: Written reply to PQs on Sun Cable
Questions: What is the most viable renewable energy source in Singapore?
answers: Solar energy is the most viable renewable energy source in Singapore.

Title: Written reply to PQs on Sun Cable
Questions: When was the National Hydrogen Strategy published?
answers: The National Hydrogen Strategy was published in October last year.

Title: Written reply to PQs on Sun Cable
Questions: What is the Expression of Interest exercise for?
answers: The Expression of Interest (EOI) exercise is for an ammonia power generation project.

Title: Written reply to PQs on Sun Cable
Questions: What is the focus of Singapore's renewable energy efforts?
answers: Singapore's renewable energy efforts are focused on accelerating the deployment of solar energy.

Title: Written reply to PQs on Sun Cable
Questions: What is the potential of solar energy in Singapore?
answers: Solar energy has the most potential as a renewable energy source in Singapore.

Title: Written reply to PQs on Sun Cable
Questions: What is the aim of the National Hydrogen Strategy?
answers: The aim of the National Hydrogen Strategy is to promote the development and use of hydrogen as a clean energy source.

Title: Written reply to PQs on Sun Cable
Questions: What is the purpose of the ammonia power generation project?
answers: The purpose of the ammonia power generation project is to generate power using ammonia as a fuel source.
